page.title: 04EAST-WEST LINK ROAD, HEMEL
page.content: The{East-West link road}was opened in January 1984, connecting the Leighton Buzzard Road with the Redbourn Road and providing access to Grovehill and Maylands Avenue Industrial Estate. This road has decreased congestion in the Town Centre and Queensway, and Piccotts End Lane, a single track, is closed to traffic. Grovehill parents are concerned about{road safety,}due to the increased flow and speed of traffic, poor fencing separating the road from housing estates and the reluctance of children to use underpasses. The present{speed limit on the new road is 30 mph but is to be raised to 50 mph. The parents have undertaken several{traffic census, showing a marked increase in vehicles passing through Grovehill. The county will not provide crossings etc as underpasses already exist.
